CatDescriptText: Mr. Fred Lampkin, laborer, 629 Turrett Street, East Liberty and Mr. George Mason, downtown hotel employee, 87 Sylvania Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 21, 1957, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think the city wage tax, which is one-half of one percent of your wage, is fair or unfair?" Mr. Fred Lampkin's answer reads: "I think it's fair because the entire city benefit from the things bought and paid for by the tax money." Mr. George Mason's answer reads: "I haven't given any consideration to the wage tax.  Therefore, at present, I can't make a statement as to whether it was fair or unfair."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Fred Lampkin, and George Mason wearing "Carlton House" patch on pocket, standing in front of brick building, with skyscraper and cars in background
